ImpNote.Paragraph: The ACME Vital Signs Monitor sends vital signs results to third party applications using HL7 Version 2.4 as described in this message profile specification.
Transport protocol:TCP/IP using the HL7 Minimum Lower Layer Protocol.

PreCondition.Value: "One or more trigger conditions (e.g. spot-check, continuous/periodic measurement or alarms) has ocurred and messages are ready for transmission."
"Sending Monitor is connnected to the Receiving Application using TCP/IP sockets."

PostCondition.Value: "Vital Sign Measurements are persisted by the Message Server."
"The Message Server will forward the message to the destination(s) configured"
"(Optional) During testing the MessageServer will validate each message instance against this message profile definition."

EventFlow.Value: "The Monitor is sending a message containing vital signs results"
"The Receiver receives and attempt to commit the message to persistent storage."
"The Receiver is unable to persist the message and returns a Commit Rejection message (ACK^R01)"
"The Receiver successfully persists the message and returns a Commit Accept message (ACK^R01)"

"If the Receiver does not respond within 10 seconds, the Sender times out and retries the transmission after ... minutes. After ... retries the Sender logs the problem and displays a message to the operator."

Conformance.StaticID: {ConfSig(1) ACME Medical Systems(1) 2.4(7) static-profile(1) ORU(47) R01(180) null(0) ORU_R01(89) 0.1(1) Sender(1)}
Conformance.DynamicID: {ConfSig(1) ACME Medical Systems(1) 2.4(7) dynamic-profile(2) AccAL_AppNE(5) immed_mode_ack(2)}

Message.EventDesc: Vital Sign Message Transmission from ACME devices

ImpNote.Paragraph: Every message begins with the MSH

ImpNote.Paragraph: Generic Identiifer for ACME vital sign
This the identifier for all devices of this type.

Field.Name: Date/Time Of Message
Field.Description: Date and time of the message transmission

Component.Name: Date/Time
Component.Description: Date and time of the message transmission

ImpNote.Paragraph: Message type is a fixed value for all
Message type is a fixed value for all
This is the unique identifier for this message instance.

HL7Definition.Paragraph: In order to ensure uniqueness, this identifier will be up to 30 characters long.

ImpNote.Paragraph: Version 2.4 is currently the only version
and therefore any previous version will
also be compatible with this specification.

Field.Name: Conformance Statement ID
Field.Description: The identifier and version of the message profile

ImpNote.Paragraph: This string references the HL7 registry OID correspondingto this profile.
The PID segment is sent in ORU messages
to identify the subject of the observation.

HL7Definition.Paragraph: Example:
PID|||412345134||Doe^Jane<CR>

Component.Name: code identifying the check digit scheme employed

ImpNote.Paragraph: The OBX segment is sent in ORU
messages to report results and alert states.
There is one OBX segment for each result or alert value.
OBX segments for periodic data are sent at a
OBX segmentsfor settings are sent only when
connection is first established and when
OBX segmentsfor alerts are sent only when the
monitor currently is in alert state. Several
the same time. In this case, all alerts
which are present at a certain time stamp
are sent with the following OBX
As soon as an alert is not displayed at the
segment. The beginning and the end
of an alert can be determined by its

HL7Definition.Paragraph: Example:
a0^bpm^MDIL|||||F<CR>

ImpNote.Paragraph: Sequence number in the segment group.
This field contains a unique identifier for
the observation. The used format is:
There are two types of observations

HL7Definition.Paragraph: Example MDIL-encoded id:
Code: 0401-0a38 , Label: Tpat, Description: Patient Temperature

ImpNote.Paragraph: This field contains a unique identifier for
Text value for the coded identifier.
Always 'MDIL'. MDIL is the coding system used by all the vital sign monitors produced by ACME.
Contains the result value or string. In case
of an alert observation, this field contains
Code corresponding to the unit of measure.

Component.Name: text
Component.Description: Description text for the units of measure

ImpNote.Paragraph: Description text for the units of measure.

Component.Name: name of coding system
Component.Description: Code identifying the code system used for the units

ImpNote.Paragraph: Always 'MDIL'. MDIL is the coding system used by all the vital sign monitors produced by ACME.
Always set to "F" for Final. The monitor sends only final results.
Indicates type of parameter. May have the
indicates a value of PERIODIC. See
Not supported by the monitor. The observation date/time in the Observation Request segment applies to all the result in this panel/battery.
